summary: Pescetarianism is a way of eating where people only consume seafood like fish and shellfish, but avoid other meats like chicken, beef, or pork. Some pescetarians also eat eggs and dairy products. It's a popular dietary choice, with around 3% of adults worldwide following this diet. The word "pescetarian" is a combination of "pesce," which means fish in Italian, and "vegetarian."
title: Pescetarianism
